meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being specific.
meanings.sent1: The specificities of the instructions were clear and easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the specificities of the recipe that made it stand out.
meanings.sent3: The specificities of the puzzle were so tricky that even the cat got confused.
meanings.sent4: His attention to the specificities of each painting revealed his true artistic talent.
meanings.sent5: The specificities of the map helped them navigate through the forest without getting lost.

meanings.definition: The details or characteristics that make something unique or distinct.
meanings.sent1: The specificities of her handwriting made it easy to identify.
meanings.sent2: He studied the specificities of each flower to understand their differences.
meanings.sent3: The specificities of his dance moves were so entertaining that everyone clapped.
meanings.sent4: The specificities of her argument were like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The specificities of the fingerprint matched those found at the crime scene.
